replies.context: "NASA generates more than $64.3 billion in total economic output yearly, supportes more than 312,000 jobs nationwide, and generated an estimated $7 billion yearly in federal, state, and local taxes throughout the US"
Where does the $64.3 billion come from?

NASA provides a LOT of business for private sector companies. And they issue contracts to private companies to build components for NASA. Thus, NASA provides a LOT of private sector jobs. And that generates money since private companies MUST work on a profit. Secondary, things invented by NASA eventually find their way into the private sector as well, such as memory foam, cochlear implants, scratch resistant coatings, insulin pump, advanced artificial limbs, LASIK, solar cells, wireless headsets..... and on and on. NASA returns much more than the take from the taxpayer.

NASA's budget in 2020 was 0.47% of the total national budget. If you're worried about government waste, start with all the illegals flowing in across our southern border - over 6,000 per day. The taxpayers pay EVERYTHING for them - clothing, food, housing, education, medical, ......
